s.text: The president's pal didn't have to do it--or he could at least have waited until Clinton was out of office.
His four years here were the most exciting part of his whole life and could have been the happiest part of his professional one.
His four years here were the most exciting part of his whole life and could have been the happiest part of his professional one.
His four years here were the most exciting part of his whole life and could have been the happiest part of his professional one.
The policy part I find inadequate and unconvincing.
There are much better books by former members of the Cabinet--George Shultz's, for example--but none that I know of that is so rich in personal detail.
He could hardly do so in a book like this one.
